page.title: 01Bolney Village
page.content: This area is part of the beautiful weald of{Kent}and{Sussex.}It is rural, mainly mixed farms, market gardens, woods and two mill ponds. Soil is heavy, fertile wealden clay. Fields are medium-sized, average about twenty hectares. Old hedges make a rich habitat for a wide variety of wildlife. There is extensive woodland, mainly deciduous, carpeted abundently with bluebells and wood anemones in spring. Undisturbed banks of primroses, wild orchids and many other wild flowers abound through the seasons. Off the{A272}into Bolney village, on the left, there are four old cottages and on the right there is a garden. The garden was first going to have houses built there, but now they have built houses further up called 'Drovers'.
